column4: hi, im using a flash player that makes you click a button before you load flash content. I want it to load flash content on at least localhost. whats my first step?
are you talking about the "Flash Block" plugin for mozilla?
i dunno, its a big triangle(play button)
yeah, go to "tools" then "addons" and click on flasblock
Then you can add "approved" sites or turn it off completely...
no transcode people in the house?
looks like it isnt intalled - the only flash plugin is called "Shockwave Flash 9.0 r100"
You are looking in the wrong place then, cause I have flash9 and it isn't listed under "add-ons"
Tools->add-ons, then make sure you are on the "Extension" tab
or i have a different version...
doubtfull
i have both FF2 and FF3 installed here and it is the same on both
tools->addons, then look at the extensions tab
so no transcode people...   Does anyone know of a different program to turn .flv into xvid or mpeg4?
yep, no flash or flash related thing, but under "plugins" it is listed as 9.0 r100. the synaptic package im using is "flashplugin-nonfree"
so there is nothing at all on your extensions tab?
when you go to tools->add-ons and click the "extension" tab up top (looks like a puzzle piece)
you get nothing on that page?
ubuntu firefox modifications
with no prefs
you got me then, it sure sounds like you have flasblock installed though
